original_title: 2025 Component Abuse Challenge: Dawg Gone LED Tester
original_content:
The Hackaday 2025 Component Abuse Challenge is all about abusing electronic components in the service of making them do things they were never intended to. Its not the 2025 Food Abuse Challenge, so in the case of [Ian Dunn]s hot dog pressed into service as an LED tester, well take the dawg to be a component in its own right. And by any measure, its being abused!
Cooking hot dogs by passing an electric current through them has a long and faintly hazardous history to it  were sure weve heard of domestic hot dog cooker appliances that are little more than the mains supply on a pin at each end of a hot dog shaped receptacle. This one takes the dawg in a bun with condiments, no less, and sticks an ordinary table fork wired up to the grid in each end. The LED testing is the cherry on the cake, because he simply sticks a pile of LEDs by their pins into the tasty sausage. It forms a crude potential divider, so theres about enough volts across the gap between pins to light it up nicely.
We like this project on so many levels, though were not sure what heavy metals would leach out of those LED pins into the meat. If its inspired you to do something similar you still have a few days in which to enter the contest, so break out your convenience food and a pile of parts, and start experimenting!
title: - 電子部品を使った料理？ホットドッグのLEDテスト挑戦
body: Hackaday 2025コンポーネント悪用チャレンジが開催中。電子部品を意外な使い方で試すプロジェクト。
titles: - 電子部品を使った料理？ホットドッグのLEDテスト挑戦
- Hackaday 2025 チャレンジ：意外な電子部品の使い方
- ホットドッグで実験！LEDと電気を使ったユニークなプロジェクト
- 安全？危険？ホットドッグを使った電子工作の裏技
- コンビニ食材で楽しむ！電子部品を駆使したDIYアイデア
